DataElement.preferredName: Inclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Body Position Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity defined at a global library level that identifies a characteristic or requirement intended to be applied to a potential study subject to determine whether they may not participate in a study. EXAMPLE(S): pregnancy A coded value specifying the 3-dimensional spatial orientation of a subject during a particular observation. EXAMPLE(S): supine, trendelenburg, standing

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Inclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Body Position Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._The spatial property of a body; where it is or the way in which it is situated.:A symbol or combination of symbols which are given certain arbitrary meanings within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Inclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The spatial property of a body; where it is or the way in which it is situated.:A symbol or combination of symbols which are given certain arbitrary meanings within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: The spatial property of a body; where it is or the way in which it is situated.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
